file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 76-11-05-04 - CONTROL STAND MASK - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CONTROL STAND MASK - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the control stand mask. B. The control stand mask is installed over the control stand assembly. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 76-11-05-000-801-A CONTROL STAND MASK - REMOVAL ALL 76-11-05-400-801-A CONTROL STAND MASK - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 76-11-05 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 76-11-05-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. CONTROL STAND MASK - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the necessary instructions to remove the control stand mask. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To disconnect the pins from the electrical Pin Extractor available wires D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 01 Does the task Cockpit H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) (For aircraft without thrust reverser) On the circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tags to them: – LIGHTS - PEDESTAL PANEL – POWERPLANT - START 1/2 – POWERPLANT - FADEC 1A/2A - 1B/2B (2) (For aircraft with thrust reverser) On the circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tags to them: – POWERPLANT - ELEC. IDLE STOP 1/2 – POWERPLANT - THRUST REVERSER 1/2 – LIGHTS - PEDESTAL PANEL – POWERPLANT - START 1/2 – POWERPLANT - FADEC 1A/2A - 1B/2B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 76-11-05 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A CAUTION: THE LIGHTED MASK IS FRAGILE. BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU REMOVE IT NOT TO HIT OR CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL OF THE COMPONENT. (1) Remove the screws (8) and washers (7) that attaches the lighted mask (1). (2) Pull the mask (1), and disconnect the electrical wires (2) from the electrical connectors (4). (Use a pin extractor). (3) Remove the mask (1). (4) Remove the screws (6) and washers (5), and remove the guide cover (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 76-11-05 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Control Stand Mask - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A DET. A B 1. MASK (LIGHTED) 8. SCREW 7. WASHER 6. SCREW 5. WASHER 2. ELECTRICAL WIRES 3. GUIDE COVER 4. ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS ACCESS PANEL (223 NZ) ACCESS PANEL DET. B (223 OZ) EM145AMM760012B.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 76-11-05 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details. PANEL LIGHTS OFF BRT PEDESTAL

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 76-11-05-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. CONTROL STAND MASK - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the necessary instructions to install the control stand mask. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 01 Does the task Cockpit H. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the guide cover (3) in position over the control stand. (2) Put the electrical wires through the applicable hole in the guide cover (3). (3) Install the guide cover (3) with the screws (6) and washers (5). (4) Connect the electrical wires (2) to the electrical connectors (4). (5) Put the mask (1) in position over the guide cover (3). (6) Install the screws (8) and washers (7) to attach the lighted mask (1) and the guide cover (3) to the access panels 223OZ and 223NZ. I. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) (For aircraft without thrust reverser) On the circuit breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tags and close these circuit breakers: • LIGHTS - PEDESTAL PANEL • POWERPLANT - START 1/2 • POWERPLANT - FADEC 1A/2A - 1B/2B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 76-11-05 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) (For aircraft with thrust reverser) On the circuit breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tags and close these circuit breakers: • POWERPLANT - ELEC. IDLE STOP 1/2 • POWERPLANT - THRUST REVERSER 1/2 • LIGHTS - PEDESTAL PANEL • POWERPLANT - START 1/2 • POWERPLANT - FADEC 1A/2A - 1B/2B (3) Make sure that the aircraft is energized. (4) Turn on the "PEDESTAL LIGHTS CONTROL" on the glareshield panel, and monitor if the inscriptions on the mask come on. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 76-11-05 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
